entry.title: What’s the Difference Between HEAD, Working Tree, and Index in Git?
entry.summary: HEAD points to the branch or commits that user last checked out. Working trees are files where users currently work, and Index is the staging area in Git.

entry.title: What’s the Difference Between Git Revert, Checkout, and Reset?
entry.summary: Git “revert” is used to undo a commit and keep changes, “checkout” is used to switch branches, and “reset” is used to unstage files from the staging area.

entry.title: What is the Meaning of “$” Sign in JavaScript
entry.summary: The $ sign is not a special character in JavaScript. Still, it can be used as an identifier, function shortcut, or in template literals.

entry.title: What is the instanceof Operator in JavaScript?
entry.summary: The “instanceof” operator determines the object type. If the object is an instance of the specified class, it gives “true”, else, it returns “false”.

entry.title: What is the Difference Between call() and bind()?
entry.summary: The call() method binds “this” value to function and executes the function, whereas the bind() method binds “this” value to function and returns a new function.

entry.title: Wait 5 Seconds Before Executing Next Line
entry.summary: To wait 5 seconds before executing the next line, use the “setTimeout()” method or the JavaScript “user-defined sleep()” function.

entry.title: Should I Run Privileged Docker Containers?

entry.title: Running Docker Containers Indefinitely
entry.summary: Docker container can be executed indefinitely by using a never-ending command such as “docker run image-name tail -f” or “docker run image-name sleep infinity”.
